meanings.definition: People who do not speak a particular language.
meanings.sent1: In the class, the teacher used pictures to help the nonspeakers understand.
meanings.sent2: The conference had translators available for nonspeakers of the local dialect.
meanings.sent3: During the game of charades, the nonspeakers had to rely on gestures to communicate.
meanings.sent4: The library, filled with books in a foreign language, seemed like a maze to the nonspeakers.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide used simple words to accommodate the nonspeakers on the tour.

meanings.definition: Those who are unable to communicate verbally.
meanings.sent1: The sign language interpreter helped the nonspeakers follow along with the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The support group provided a safe space for nonspeakers to express themselves.
meanings.sent3: At the silent retreat, even the nonspeakers found peace in the quiet surroundings.
meanings.sent4: The radio show catered to nonspeakers by including visual descriptions in their broadcasts.
meanings.sent5: The therapist used art therapy to connect with the nonspeakers in the group session.
